title: Effortless Crock Pot Beef Stew for Cozy Nights
promptIMG: Food photography: Beef stew, appetizing presentation, natural lighting, kitchen setting, documentary style, realistic colors --ar 4:3 --quality 2
description: This easy crock pot beef stew is the ultimate comfort food. With tender beef and hearty veggies, it's perfect for chilly nights. Just set it and enjoy the aromas filling your kitchen!
ingredients: 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the beef cubes on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Transfer the browned beef to the crock pot and add the carrots, potatoes, onion, and garlic.
In a bowl, mix the beef broth, tomato paste, thyme, salt, and pepper. Pour over the meat and veggies in the crock pot.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours until the beef is tender and the flavors meld together.
Serve hot with crusty bread for a heartwarming meal.
tips: One tip I swear by is to brown the beef first; it adds so much depth to the flavor. Also, don’t skip the garlic—it really elevates the stew. If you want to make it even heartier, feel free to throw in some peas or green beans in the last hour of cooking. Leftovers taste even better the next day, so don’t hesitate to make a big batch!

structured_content.content: Quick note: There's something so comforting about a warm bowl of beef stew, especially when it's made effortlessly in a crock pot. This Easy Crock Pot Beef Stew is my go-to for chilly nights. It’s packed with tender beef, hearty vegetables, and a rich broth that warms you from the inside out. Plus, the best part? You can set it and forget it!

For this stew, you'll need some good quality beef chuck, which becomes incredibly tender during the long cooking process. Carrots and potatoes add heartiness, while the onion and garlic bring depth. If you're out of beef broth, chicken broth works just fine, and you can even throw in some frozen peas at the end for a pop of color.
Start by browning the beef in a skillet to develop flavor. Then, just toss everything into the crock pot and let it do its magic! In about 8 hours on low, you'll have a delicious meal ready to go.

upload.context: Beef stew in a rustic bowl on a wooden table

structured_content.content: Here's the thing - This stew is perfect for family dinners or meal prep for the week. Serve it with some crusty bread to soak up that rich broth. You can also add your favorite herbs like rosemary or bay leaves for a little twist!
